metadata.title: CVE-2016-9793 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The sock_setsockopt function in net/core/sock.c in the Linux kernel before4.8.14 mishandles negative values of sk_sndbuf and sk_rcvbuf, which allowslocal users to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and systemcrash) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveraging theCAP_NET_ADMIN capability for a crafted setsockopt system call with the (1)SO_SNDBUFFORCE or (2) SO_RCVBUFFORCE option.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9793` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-107-generic - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-lowlatency - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-107-generic - 3.13.0-107.154
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-79-generic - 3.19.0-79.87~14.04.1

linux-image-4.4.0-59-generic - 4.4.0-59.80~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-107.154').
